intro.description: Welcome to the Test Framework Powerunit tutorial. It will help you build a test framework based on Powerunit. Let's get started!

item.title: Create the test supporting class
item.description: In this step, we will create a test class, which will be the testframework itself. To do so, open the wizard Create a Powerunit test case and create a new powerunit test class. Specify that the test is Parameterized.

item.title: Create the test interface
item.description: In this step, we will create the test interface. This interface exposes the configuration for the test framework. To do so, open the wizard to create a new test class.

item.title: Transform the new class into test interface
item.description: Add the annotation @TestInterface(...) to the new created class. The attribute of this annotation will be the class created in the step "Create the test supporting class".

item.title: Transform the test supporting class into a test framework
item.description: Add the annotation @TestDelegator to the class create in the step "Create the test supporting class". Then modify the method "getDatas" to have one parameter, which is of type of the class created in the step "create the test interface".
